title: AUS vs IND Tests, where to watch live: TV channels and live streaming for Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25
description: The highly anticipated Border-Gavaskar Trophy will feature five Tests. Here's where to watch the first Test in Perth with TV channels and live streaming listings.
author: Katya Witney
excerpt: The highly anticipated Border-Gavaskar Trophy will feature five Tests. Here's where to watch the first Test in Perth with TV channels and live streaming listings.
text: The highly anticipated Border-Gavaskar Trophy will feature five Tests. Here's where to watch the first Test in Perth with TV channels and live streaming listings. AUS vs IND: Perth Test preview The final preparations are underway for the marquee series which will see India and Australia play five Tests against each other. After the series kicks off in Perth, the second Test will be played in Adelaide before stops in Brisbane and Melbourne before the final Test in Sydney which will take place in the New Year. India have had some selection dilemmas heading into the first Test. With captain Rohit Sharma not set to arrive in Australia until after the start of the match and No.3 Shubman Gill injured, India have added top-order batter Devdutt Padikkal to their squad on the eve of the match. India are also coming off the back of a devastating rare home Test series loss to New Zealand. — Wisden (@WisdenCricket) November 21, 2024 Australia will be fielding a new opener in Nathan McSweeney, who replaces Steve Smith at the top of the order. Smith will move back down into the middle-order in Cameron Green's absence through injury, allowing space for McSweeney to partner Usman Khawaja at the top. India won both of the last two editions of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, and also won the last two editions in India. Australia haven't won a Test series against India in a decade. Where to watch the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25 on TV and live stream India TV channels: Star Sports 1, Star Sports 1 HD, Star Sports 1 Hindi, Star Sports 1 Hindi HD, Star Sports 1 Tamil, Star Sports 1 Tamil HD, Star Sports 1 Telugu, Star Sports 1 Telugu HD, Star Sports 1 Kannada Live stream: Disney+ Hotstar Australia TV channels: Fox Cricket, Seven Live stream: Foxtel, 7plusSport UK TV channels: TNT Sports 1 Live stream: Discovery+ app USA If you’re based in the US, you can watch India's tour of South Africa on Willow. html:
The highly anticipated Border-Gavaskar Trophy will feature five Tests. Here's where to watch the first Test in Perth with TV channels and live streaming listings.

AUS vs IND: Perth Test preview

The final preparations are underway for the marquee series which will see India and Australia play five Tests against each other. After the series kicks off in Perth, the second Test will be played in Adelaide before stops in Brisbane and Melbourne before the final Test in Sydney which will take place in the New Year.

India have had some selection dilemmas heading into the first Test. With captain Rohit Sharma not set to arrive in Australia until after the start of the match and No.3 Shubman Gill injured, India have added top-order batter Devdutt Padikkal to their squad on the eve of the match. India are also coming off the back of a devastating rare home Test series loss to New Zealand.

— Wisden (@WisdenCricket) November 21, 2024

Australia will be fielding a new opener in Nathan McSweeney, who replaces Steve Smith at the top of the order. Smith will move back down into the middle-order in Cameron Green's absence through injury, allowing space for McSweeney to partner Usman Khawaja at the top.

India won both of the last two editions of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, and also won the last two editions in India. Australia haven't won a Test series against India in a decade.

Where to watch the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25 on TV and live stream

India

TV channels: Star Sports 1, Star Sports 1 HD, Star Sports 1 Hindi, Star Sports 1 Hindi HD, Star Sports 1 Tamil, Star Sports 1 Tamil HD, Star Sports 1 Telugu, Star Sports 1 Telugu HD, Star Sports 1 Kannada

Live stream: Disney+ Hotstar

Australia

TV channels: Fox Cricket, Seven

Live stream: Foxtel, 7plusSport

UK

TV channels: TNT Sports 1

Live stream: Discovery+ app

USA

If you’re based in the US, you can watch India's tour of South Africa on Willow. Find out more here.
